decision_title: IND submission readiness — conditional go with author-at-risk, reviewer triage, and publishing lock points
decision_question: Is the evidence sufficient to submit the initial IND on 2026-01-20 while maintaining regulatory defensibility, given (a) pivotal GLP tox report is currently an audited draft and (b) clinical stability dataset is limited to 1‑month at time of submission?

options_considered.description: Submit the IND as an unconditional go using the current package without explicitly governing audited-draft tox and limited stability.
cons: Treats open items as closed; increases likelihood of preventable FDA questions and downstream rework
options_considered.estimated_impact: On-time submission but elevated regulatory friction risk due to implied certainty.

options_considered.description: Submit the IND as a conditional go with explicit author-at-risk items, reviewer triage, and publishing lock points, plus owned closure evidence.
pros: Maintains submission date while preserving defensibility
Creates controlled pathway to reconcile audited-draft tox and rolling stability updates
cons: Requires disciplined follow-through and change control
options_considered.estimated_impact: On-time submission with medium residual risk managed through explicit conditions, lock points, and triage rules.

options_considered.description: Delay submission 6–8 weeks to wait for final signed tox report and additional stability timepoints before filing.
pros: Reduces uncertainty at time of submission
cons: Material delay to program timeline; may not materially improve safety posture compared to a governed conditional go
options_considered.estimated_impact: Lower uncertainty at filing at the cost of significant schedule impact and potential loss of strategic window.

conditions.condition: Replace audited-draft GLP tox report with final signed report and reconcile any deltas across Module 2 summaries and IB.
conditions.evidence_to_close: Final signed GLP tox report + change propagation log showing updates to Module 2.6 summaries and IB where applicable.

conditions.condition: Provide rolling stability update (additional timepoints) and confirm shelf-life statement remains appropriately qualified.
conditions.evidence_to_close: Updated stability report + revised Module 3 stability section + documented justification for any shelf-life language.

conditions.condition: Confirm final eCTD publishing lock points and perform final cross-document consistency QC after lock.
conditions.evidence_to_close: Publishing plan with lock approvals + final QC checklist sign-off + version manifest.

decision_outcome.rationale_summary: Evidence is sufficient to submit the initial IND on the target date only if remaining uncertainty is treated as governed work rather than implied certainty. The pivotal tox report is currently an audited draft and the stability dataset is limited at time of submission; both are recorded as author‑at‑risk items with named owners, due dates, and required closure evidence. Publishing lock points and reviewer triage rules constrain late-breaking changes to prevent cross-document inconsistencies after content freeze. This conditional-go outcome balances speed with defensibility by making commitments explicit and measurable, and by establishing a contingency pathway if final report deltas or stability updates materially change the risk picture.

evidence_items.quality_notes: Audited draft acceptable for drafting and submission only if reconciled to final signed report with documented deltas.

evidence_items.quality_notes: Aligned to audited-draft tox; requires propagation check upon final tox issuance.

evidence_items.title: Clinical batch stability dataset (1-month timepoint)
evidence_items.quality_notes: Limited timepoints; shelf-life statements must remain qualified and updated with rolling stability data.

evidence_items.title: Protocol (Module 5) — submission-ready draft
evidence_items.quality_notes: Protocol is dependent on tox and CMC reconciliations; ensure cross-document consistency for dosing and handling.

evidence_items.title: AI-assisted consistency checklist (informational)
evidence_items.quality_notes: Checklist output reviewed by required reviewers; not a decision recommendation.

gaps.gap: Pivotal tox report is an audited draft at time of submission (final signatures pending).
gaps.impact: Potential deltas could require updates across Module 2.6 summaries, IB, and protocol dosing narrative.
gaps.mitigation_plan: Treat as author-at-risk item with mandatory reconciliation and propagation log; triage re-review if NOAEL/margins change.

gaps.gap: Stability dataset limited to early timepoints at time of submission.
gaps.impact: Shelf-life and storage statements must remain qualified and may prompt FDA questions.
gaps.mitigation_plan: Use conservative qualifiers; deliver rolling stability update and align language across documents under change control.

assumptions.assumption: Final tox report will not materially change the NOAEL interpretation or starting dose justification.
assumptions.risk_if_wrong: Could require protocol/IB narrative adjustments and potentially agency communication.
assumptions.how_to_verify: Compare final signed report to audited draft; quantify deltas; re-review per triage rules if thresholds exceeded.

assumptions.assumption: Additional stability timepoints will support continued qualified shelf-life language without a major change in storage conditions.
assumptions.risk_if_wrong: Could require more conservative shelf-life statements and updates to Module 3 and cross-references.
assumptions.how_to_verify: Review new timepoints upon availability; update qualifiers and obtain CMC + QA approval before incorporation.

key_risks.risk: Final tox report deltas vs audited draft affect dose justification and safety margin narrative.
key_risks.mitigation: Condition 1 requires reconciliation and propagation log; triage rule triggers immediate re-review if deltas affect NOAEL or dosing margin.

key_risks.risk: Limited stability dataset prompts FDA questions or requires more conservative shelf-life qualifiers.
key_risks.mitigation: Condition 2 mandates rolling stability update and consistent qualifiers across Module 3, IB, and protocol; CMC + QA sign-off required for qualifier changes.

key_risks.risk: Late-breaking edits after publishing lock create inter-document inconsistencies in the eCTD package.
key_risks.mitigation: Publishing lock points constrain late changes; Submission Manager approval required post-lock; final consistency QC checklist must be completed before package assembly.

risk_assessment.residual_risk_statement: Residual risk is medium: uncertainties remain at submission time (audited-draft tox and limited stability) but are bounded and managed through explicit conditions, lock points, and triage rules.

risk_posture.rationale: Balanced posture: proceed on target date with explicit, owned conditions and change control rather than treating incomplete data as complete or delaying by default.
trade_offs: Maintains schedule while accepting managed uncertainty at submission
Increases governance overhead slightly to reduce downstream rework and regulatory surprises

dependency_map.dependency: Final signed GLP tox report issuance
dependency_map.why_it_matters: Changes may require updates across Module 2.6 summaries, IB, and dosing rationale narrative.
Supports qualified shelf-life statements and may affect CMC narrative in Module 3 and IB.
Determines when content freezes and what late changes can be safely incorporated without inconsistency.

author_at_risk_items.description: Module 2.6 tox narrative built from audited-draft tox report v0.9
author_at_risk_items.verification: Reconcile the Module 2.6 tox narrative, IB, and protocol dosing rationale to the final signed tox report; document any deltas and how they were propagated across all impacted sections.
author_at_risk_items.fallback: If the final tox report slips beyond the reconciliation deadline, document why the audited draft remains acceptable for submission and pre-stage an FDA information-request response package referencing the audited-to-final delta analysis.

author_at_risk_items.description: Shelf-life language is qualified due to 1‑month stability limitation
author_at_risk_items.verification: Confirm qualifiers are consistent across Module 3, IB, and protocol; update upon new stability timepoints.
author_at_risk_items.fallback: If qualifiers cannot be aligned before lock, lock conservative language and document deviation with QA approval.

triage_rules: If final tox deltas change NOAEL or dosing margin interpretation, trigger immediate re-review by Regulatory Lead + Nonclinical Lead + Clinical Lead within 24 hours.
If stability update changes qualified shelf-life statement, require CMC Lead + QA Representative sign-off before incorporation.
After publishing lock, only Submission Manager may approve late changes; changes must be accompanied by a propagation checklist entry.
review_plan.review_window: Standard review: 2 business days; late-breaking inserts: same-day triage with required reviewers only.

lock_points.what_locks: Clinical protocol + IB/GIP narrative freeze for publishing formatting
Final eCTD package assembly begins; only critical fixes permitted with QA approval

tpp_links.relevance: Risk posture assumes initial study population and protocol are aligned to TPP minimum viable claim.
Dosing rationale depends on tox margins and CMC control; deltas trigger triage per review plan.
Stability limitations are managed through qualified statements and rolling updates tied to TPP expectations.
